title: I bought a drain snake. How do I use it to unclog?
text:
To use a drain snake to unclog a drain, follow these steps: 1. Gather tools and materials: drain snake, rag, 1/8 hand auger, utility knife, small bowl or bucket, and petroleum jelly. 2. Remove P-trap from drain: Follow local manual or provided manual. 3. Place drain snake in drain: Bend auger at 45° angle. 4. Extend snake: Start with 1 foot (30.5cm) at bottom. 5. Cut pipe tape and plumbers putty: Apply petroleum jelly around MBber plunger lip. 6. Extend snake: Place drain snake in drain. 7. Continue working up pipe: Turn drum to extend snake. 8. Remove snake and clean inside: Apply petroleum jelly around MBber plunger lip. 9. Extend snake: Place drain snake in drain. 10. Continue working up pipe. 11. Remove snake and clean inside: Apply petroleum jelly around MBber plunger lip. 12. Extend snake: Place drain snake in drain. 13. Continue working up pipe. 14. Remove snake and clean inside: Apply petroleum jelly around MBber plunger lip. 15. Extend snake: Place drain snake in drain. 16. Continue working up pipe. 17. Remove snake and clean inside: Apply petroleum jelly around MBber plunger lip. 18. Extend snake: Place drain snake in drain. 19. Continue working up pipe. 20. Remove snake and clean inside: Apply petroleum jelly around MBber plunger lip. 21. Extend snake: Place drain snake in drain. 22. Continue working up pipe. 23. Remove snake and clean inside: Apply petroleum jelly around MBber plunger lip. 24. Extend snake: Place drain snake in drain. 25. Continue working up pipe. 26. Remove snake and clean inside: Apply petroleum jelly around MBber plunger lip. 27. Extend snake: Place drain snake in drain. 28. Continue working up pipe.

First step: Make the area safe and ready: turn off any relevant utilities (such as power, water, or gas) and clear and protect the work area so you can see and reach the problem clearly.
